# Draft:Millennium Excellence Awards

Instituted in 2000 and held every five years under the patronage of His Royal Majesty Otumfuo Osei Tutu II, the Millennium Excellence Awards (MEA) elevate pan-African excellence. The awards aim to celebrate outstanding contributions across sectors such as science, education, business, climate advocacy, entertainment, and humanitarian service. They have honored notable personalities like Archbishop Desmond Tutu, Kofi Annan, and Mo Ibrahim over the years, setting a high standard for impactful leadership.
2025 Edition
The latest MEA event took place on May 9, 2025, at Manhyia Palace in Kumasi, personally overseen by the Asantehene. Over 49 nominees across various categories participated, including academics, business leaders, climate activists, entertainers, and innovators. Notable Awardees were:
* Prof. Gordon A. Awandare received the Biomedical Finding – Global Excellence Award, honored for securing over $40 million in research funding for the West African Centre for Cell Biology of Infectious Pathogens (WACCBIP)..
* Emeritus Prof. Clifford Nii Boi Tagoe was honored for Mathematics & Science Excellence, recognized for his leadership and advocacy in STEM education.
* Prof. Emmanuel Ohene Afoakwa, Vice-Chancellor of Ghana Communication Technology University, received a Laureate of Distinction in Natural Sciences for work in cocoa research and food processing.
* Dr. Samuel Dotse, CEO of HATOF Foundation, earned Laureate of Distinction in Climate Change for his role in climate finance, biodiversity advocacy, and global environmental diplomacy.
* Prof. Ellis Owusu-Dabo of KNUST won the Leadership in Biomedical Excellence Award for training over 2,000 primary healthcare workers and advancing continental health research.
* Kofi Kinaata, the celebrated Highlife artist, was awarded Youth in Entertainment for his socially conscious music and influence among Ghanaian youth
Significance and Impact
* The MEA acknowledges individuals advancing Ghana’s global standing through STEM, agriculture, climate action, digital innovation, and creative arts.
* By spotlighting environmental advocates and biomedical researchers, the awards showcase often-overlooked but critical contributions.
* With global nominations and international achievements, the awards reinforce Ghana’s role in continent-wide development.
* Through Manhyia Palace, the ceremony blends traditional authority with modern values, enhancing the Asantehene’s role in national discourse
